keyword: calories in new york steak 8 oz
title: Calories in 8 oz New York Steak
meta_description: Learn calories in new york steak 8 oz, with full nutrition facts including protein, fat, carbs, and easy tweaks for different preparations.
h1: Calories in 8 oz New York Steak
assumptions: Boneless New York strip steak, cooked (grilled or broiled), trimmed of visible fat, no added oils, marinades, or seasonings; choice grade beef.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cut, grade, cooking method, fat trimming, and portion size. Check labels or use a food scale for accuracy.

quick_answer.text: An 8 oz cooked New York steak offers ~522 kcal and ~61 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp oil per 100 g for cooking
Untrimmed visible fat (fattier cut) per 100 g
Pan-seared with 1 tbsp butter for the whole steak

faqs.q: How many calories in 8 oz New York steak?
faqs.a: Approximately 522 kcal for cooked, trimmed boneless New York strip steak.

faqs.q: What's the protein in 8 oz New York steak?
faqs.a: About 61 g of protein, making it a high-protein choice.

faqs.q: Does cooking method affect calories in New York steak?
faqs.a: Yes—grilling keeps it lower; frying with oil or butter adds 40–100 kcal per 100 g.

faqs.q: Are carbs in New York steak 8 oz?
faqs.a: Zero carbs, as it's pure meat with no added ingredients.

faqs.q: How does fat trimming change calories in New York steak?
faqs.a: Trimming reduces fat and calories by ~50 kcal per 100 g compared to untrimmed.
